> In my experience, a missing class file results in a
> ClassNotFoundExcept=
ion. ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when
> you _can_ find the class, but n=
ot a resulting definition.

I'm currently working on a problem where a clas=
s cannot be loaded because it
contains a catch block catching a JNLP except=
ion, but the jnlp.jar is not in
the classpath. This results in a ClassDefNo=
tFoundError, not an Exception.
(And no, no static initializer involved.)
